exercises.name: Kettlebell Swing (two-hand)
exercises.purpose: Hip power, posterior chain strength, conditioning transfer, back resilience.
setup: Stand with feet about shoulder width; KB a foot in front of you.
Hinge: push hips back, keep shins nearly vertical, spine neutral.
Grip the handle, tilt the bell toward you, pack shoulders (armpits tight).
steps: Hike-pass the bell back high between thighs (like snapping a football).
Snap hips forward hard; squeeze glutes; bell floats to chest height.
Arms stay relaxed like hooks; do not lift with shoulders.
Let the bell fall; hinge again; repeat. Breathing: sharp exhale at the top.
common_mistakes: Squatting instead of hinging (knees too far forward).
Overextending at the top (ribs flaring, leaning back).
Lifting with arms/shoulders instead of driving with hips.
Letting the bell drop low (keep it high in the hinge).
regressions: Swing with lighter bell (35–44 lb) and fewer reps.
progressions: Increase bell weight (53–70 lb) while keeping crisp form.
Increase density: EMOM (every minute on the minute) sets.
One-hand swings after Week 6 if shoulders feel great.

exercises.name: Turkish Get-Up (TGU)
exercises.purpose: Shoulder stability, core control, hip mobility, total-body coordination (excellent for duty durability).
setup: Lie on back; KB in right hand, arm vertical; right knee bent, left leg straight.
Left arm at ~45 degrees for support; eyes on the bell.
steps: Roll to left elbow (keep right arm locked).
Post to left hand; lift hips into a bridge (high hips).
Sweep left leg under to a lunge position (left knee under hip).
Windshield-wiper the back leg to square up; stand.
Reverse the steps back down with control. Switch sides.
common_mistakes: Bent elbow (keep the bell-side elbow locked).
Letting the knee collapse inward on the lunge.
regressions: Do it unloaded (shoe on fist) for 3 reps/side.
Use 35 lb and do partial get-ups (to elbow / to hand) first.
progressions: Increase weight gradually (44–62 lb).
Add pauses: 2 seconds at elbow/hand/bridge/lunge.

exercises.name: Goblet Squat (KB or DB)
exercises.purpose: Leg strength, hip mobility, posture under load.
setup: Hold KB horns at chest (or a DB vertically).
Feet shoulder width; toes slightly out; brace core.
steps: Sit down between hips; knees track over toes.
Keep chest tall; elbows inside knees at the bottom.
Drive up through midfoot; exhale near the top.
regressions: Box squat to a chair; reduce depth.
progressions: Heavier bell (53–70 lb).
Tempo squats: 3 seconds down, 1 second pause.

exercises.name: DB Romanian Deadlift (RDL)
exercises.purpose: Hamstrings/glutes/back strength; protects knees by strengthening hinge pattern.
setup: DBs in hands; stand tall; slight knee bend; ribs down.
steps: Hinge hips back; slide DBs down thighs; keep spine neutral.
Go to mid-shin or when hamstrings limit without rounding.
Drive hips forward; squeeze glutes at top.
common_mistakes: Turning into a squat (too much knee bend).
progressions: Heavier DBs, fewer reps (5–8).
Single-leg RDL (balance).

exercises.name: DB Floor Press
exercises.purpose: Press strength with shoulder-friendly range; builds push power for duty/combatives.
setup: Lie on floor; knees bent; DBs over chest; shoulder blades pulled down and back.
steps: Lower elbows to floor under control (45 degrees from body).
Pause lightly; press up to lockout; do not shrug.
progressions: Heavier DBs or pause reps.
Neutral grip for shoulder comfort.

exercises.name: DB Push Press
exercises.purpose: Explosive overhead power; transfers to lifting, striking strength, and gear handling.
setup: DBs at shoulders; feet hip width; brace core; glutes tight.
steps: Dip 2–4 inches (small knee bend).
Drive hard and press overhead; lockout with biceps near ears.
Lower with control back to shoulders.
progressions: Heavier DBs; reduce reps to 4–6.

exercises.name: 1-Arm DB Row
exercises.purpose: Pull strength for grappling, posture, and shoulder health; direct pull-up support.
setup: One hand on bench/chair; hinge; back flat; DB hangs under shoulder.
steps: Row DB to ribs/hip; elbow tight; pause 1 second.
Lower under control; keep torso still.
progressions: Heavier DB; 5–8 reps.
Chest-supported row if you add a bench.

exercises.name: Pull-up (strict) + Progressions
exercises.purpose: Climbing readiness, grip, upper-back strength, PFQ benefit, combatives control.
setup: Hands shoulder width; full hang; ribs down; glutes lightly tight.
steps: Pull elbows to ribs; chest toward bar; chin clears bar.
Lower to full hang under control (2–3 seconds).
common_mistakes: Kipping or swinging; half reps; craning neck.
Shrugging shoulders to ears (no shoulder pack).
regressions: Negatives: jump to top, lower 5–8 seconds.
progressions: Add weight with backpack once you can do 8+ clean reps.
EMOM density: 2–3 reps each minute for 10 minutes.

exercises.name: Farmer Carry / Suitcase Carry
exercises.purpose: Grip, trunk stiffness, posture under load, real-world strength (kids/gear).
setup: Pick up heavy DBs (or one DB for suitcase). Stand tall; ribs down; chin tucked.
steps: Walk slow and steady; shoulders down; avoid leaning.
Switch sides each set for suitcase carry.
progressions: Longer time 60–90 seconds; heavier weight.

exercises.name: Sandbag Bear-Hug Carry
exercises.purpose: Odd-object strength, grappling carryover, back and trunk durability.
setup: Hug bag high on chest; elbows down; brace; tall posture.
steps: Walk controlled; short steps; breathe behind the shield (slow exhales).
progressions: 60–80 lb; 40–60 sec sets; add slight hills.

exercises.name: Plank / Side Plank / Dead Bug
exercises.purpose: Core stiffness without spinal wear; protects back; transfers to fighting and rucking.
setup: Plank: elbows under shoulders; ribs down; glutes tight.
Side plank: elbow under shoulder; hips stacked.
steps: Hold steady; breathe; avoid sagging.
Dead bug: low back pressed into floor; move opposite arm/leg slowly.
common_mistakes: Hips sagging; holding breath; fast dead bug reps.
progressions: Longer holds; add suitcase carry core work.

exercises.name: Rucking (20 lb)
exercises.purpose: Aerobic base, leg/tendon durability, kit tolerance, fat loss with low joint impact.
setup: Pack weight high and tight; shoulder straps snug; waist belt if available.
Foot care: tape hotspots early; wool socks; dry feet post-ruck.
steps: Walk at conversational pace (Zone 2).
Posture: tall; ribs down; short stride; arms swing naturally.
common_mistakes: Too much weight too soon; trying to jog with a ruck.
progressions: Add time first; then consider 25–30 lb after Week 4 if joints feel good.

exercises.name: Norwegian 4x4 (VO2max Intervals)
exercises.purpose: Raise VO2 max and improve high-end aerobic power with sustained, repeatable hard efforts.
setup: Peloton bike preferred (lower impact while rebuilding).
If you have a heart-rate strap, pair it (optional). Otherwise use RPE and output consistency.
Pick a ride where you control intensity: ‘Just Ride/Scenic’, a Power Zone ride, or ignore instructor callouts and ride your targets.
steps: Warm-up: 10 minutes easy (Zone 1–2). Add 2–3 x 20s smooth pickups with 40s easy.
Work x4: 4 minutes hard in Power Zone 5 OR RPE 8–9 (you can say 1–3 words).
Recover: 3 minutes very easy (Zone 1–2). Let breathing settle.
Cool-down: 5–10 minutes easy + calves/hips mobility.
common_mistakes: Starting rep 1 like a sprint (you’ll fade badly by rep 3–4).
Making recoveries too hard (they should feel almost ‘too easy’).
Chasing a peak output instead of a repeatable output. Aim for steadiness across all 4 reps (within ~5%).
regressions: If knees/feet are cranky, keep it on the bike until tolerance improves.
progressions: After 2–3 weeks at full 4x4, add a small amount of output while keeping all 4 reps within ~5%.
Optional: add 10–15 minutes Zone 2 after the intervals if time allows.
If you know your FTP: target ~105–120% FTP for work reps, but prioritize repeatability.

exercises.name: Push-up
exercises.purpose: Upper-body pushing strength/endurance, trunk stiffness, shoulder health when done with good mechanics.
setup: Hands slightly wider than shoulders; screw hands into floor (external rotation torque).
Body in a straight line: ribs down, glutes lightly squeezed, chin tucked.
steps: Lower under control until chest is just above floor (or to a target like a yoga block).
Elbows about 30–45° from torso (not flared straight out).
Press back up by pushing the floor away; keep whole body moving as one unit.
regressions: Incline push-ups on a bench/counter (same body line).
Knees push-ups only if you can keep a straight line from knees to head.
progressions: Feet elevated push-ups.
Tempo: 3 seconds down, pause 1, press up.
Weighted vest/plate (later).

exercises.name: Dead Bug
exercises.purpose: Anti-extension core control (protects low back), improves brace for lifting/carries.
setup: Lie on back, knees/hips at 90°, arms to ceiling.
Flatten ribs toward pelvis (gentle posterior pelvic tilt).
steps: Slowly extend opposite arm and leg away from center while keeping low back from arching.
Pause briefly; return; alternate sides.
Breathe out on the reach; inhale on return.
regressions: Only move legs (arms stay up) or only move arms.
progressions: Add a light dumbbell to the moving hand.
Longer lever: extend leg lower to the floor without arching.

exercises.name: Side Plank
exercises.purpose: Lateral core strength (anti-rotation), hip stability, duty/ruck transfer.
setup: Elbow under shoulder; forearm on floor; feet stacked (or staggered).
Body straight line head-to-heels; top shoulder stacked over bottom.
steps: Lift hips; squeeze glutes; keep ribs down.
Hold while breathing slowly through nose.
Switch sides.
progressions: Top leg raises.
Weighted side plank (light plate/DB on hip).

exercises.name: Plank
exercises.purpose: Trunk stiffness for carries/lifting; protects back when you can breathe under tension.
setup: Elbows under shoulders; forearms parallel.
Ribs down; glutes lightly squeezed; quads on.
steps: Hold a straight line head-to-heels; breathe slowly (no breath-holding).
If form breaks, stop—quality over time.
common_mistakes: Hips too high (turns into shoulder hold).
progressions: RKC plank (harder: pull elbows toward toes).
Plank with shoulder taps (anti-rotation).

exercises.name: Couch Stretch (Hip Flexor)
exercises.purpose: Hip flexor/quadriceps mobility—useful for rucking, sitting in a cruiser, squatting mechanics.
setup: Kneel with back shin against couch/wall; front foot planted in a lunge.
Start upright; lightly squeeze glute on the back-leg side.
steps: Tuck pelvis slightly (ribs down) and gently shift forward until you feel the stretch in hip flexor/quad.
Hold 45–90s per side, breathing slowly.
common_mistakes: Overarching low back to chase range.
regressions: Move farther from wall (less knee bend).
Do a standard half-kneeling hip flexor stretch.
progressions: Reach same-side arm overhead while keeping ribs down.
Add a gentle glute squeeze + exhale to deepen.

exercises.name: Open Book (Thoracic Rotation)
exercises.purpose: Thoracic mobility for shoulder health, posture, and breathing mechanics.
setup: Lie on side, hips and knees bent; knees stacked on each other.
Arms straight out in front, palms together.
steps: Rotate top arm across your body, opening chest toward the floor behind you.
Keep knees together (use a pillow between knees if needed).
Breathe out as you open; pause 1–2 seconds; return. 6–10 reps/side.
common_mistakes: Knees separating or hips rolling back.
Forcing range with shoulder instead of trunk.
regressions: Support the top arm with a pillow.
progressions: Hold end range 3–5 seconds each rep.
Add slow nasal breathing (4–6 sec exhales).

exercises.name: Calf Stretch (Gastrocnemius/Soleus)
exercises.purpose: Improve ankle mobility and reduce calf/foot tightness for running/rucking.
setup: Hands on wall; one foot back, heel down.
Keep toes pointed forward.
steps: Straight-knee stretch (gastroc): back leg straight, lean in 45–60s.
Bent-knee stretch (soleus): bend back knee slightly, keep heel down 45–60s.
Repeat both sides.
progressions: Add ankle rocks 10 reps after stretching.
Do calf raises 2x10 after (strength + mobility).

exercises.name: Step-Up (weighted optional)
exercises.purpose: Single-leg strength and knee/hip stability; good for stairs, pursuits, ruck terrain.
setup: Use a stable box/step (knee roughly 90° or lower).
Foot fully on the box; torso tall.
steps: Drive through the working foot to stand on the box; avoid pushing off the back foot.
Control the descent; keep knee tracking over toes.
Do all reps one side or alternate.
progressions: Hold DBs at sides or a sandbag bear-hug.
Slow eccentric: 3 seconds down.

exercises.name: Burpee (scaled)
exercises.purpose: Full-body conditioning; explosive get-up ability (scale to protect joints).
setup: Clear space; pick your scale before you start.
Options: step-back burpee, no-push-up, no-jump, hands-elevated.
steps: Hands down → step or jump feet back to plank.
Optional push-up → step/jump feet forward.
Stand tall (optional small hop).
common_mistakes: Letting low back sag in plank.
Going too fast and losing mechanics.
progressions: Add push-up + small jump.
Add target (touch overhead).

exercises.name: Breathing Reset (2 minutes)
exercises.purpose: Downshift stress, improve recovery between shifts and sessions; reinforces rib position for core control.
setup: Sit or lie on back with knees bent.
One hand on belly, one on chest.
steps: Inhale through nose 3–4 seconds, feel belly expand.
Exhale 5–7 seconds, feel ribs drop and abs gently engage.
Repeat for 2 minutes.
progressions: Add 2-second pause after exhale.
Try box breathing 4-4-4-4 when stressed.

exercises.name: Peloton Zone 2 Ride (Aerobic Base)
exercises.purpose: Build aerobic base and recovery capacity; supports VO2 gains and rucking without beating up joints.
setup: Choose 'Just Ride/Scenic' or a low-intensity class you can ride at your target.
Use talk test: you should be able to speak in sentences.
steps: Warm up 5 min easy.
Ride 20–60+ min at easy conversational effort (RPE 3–4).
Cool down 3–5 min easy.
progressions: Add 5 minutes per week until 45–60 min.
Keep it easy even when you feel good.

exercises.name: CastleFlexx Routine (calves/hamstrings/hips)
exercises.purpose: Assisted stretching sequence using CastleFlexx to improve lower-body mobility for rucking and riding.
setup: Use the CastleFlexx as directed by the manufacturer; keep movement pain-free.
Aim for 'mild to moderate' stretch, not sharp pain.
steps: Calf stretch: 45–60s/side (straight knee), then 45–60s/side (bent knee).
Hamstring stretch: 45–60s/side, keep spine long (no rounding).
Hip/quad stretch (if supported): 45–60s/side.
Finish with 3 slow breaths.
progressions: Add a second round on tight sides.
Use after VO2 day and ruck day.

exercises.name: Chirp Wheel Routine (T-spine extension)
exercises.purpose: Thoracic spine mobility and postural reset—helpful for desk/cruiser posture and shoulder comfort.
setup: Use a chirp wheel size that feels safe; start with gentler size first.
Support head/neck as needed; keep pressure comfortable.
steps: Place wheel at mid-back; gently extend over it while breathing out.
Roll 1–2 inches up/down to find tight spots; pause 20–30s and breathe.
Do 3–5 positions from mid-back to upper-back (avoid direct pressure on low back).
Finish with 6 open books per side.
common_mistakes: Putting wheel on low back instead of mid/upper back.
regressions: Use largest wheel and smaller range.
progressions: Add gentle overhead reach while breathing out.
Combine with couch stretch after long shifts.
